title: Structured chat commands

detailed_design.description: Define a small set of slash-style commands (e.g. /status, /reset, /think) and document them. Enables consistent behaviour across Telegram and any future channel adapters. Commands are handled before routing to the model where appropriate.
detailed_design.solution: 1. Define command set: e.g. /status (return session/model status), /reset (clear session or start new conversation), /think (set thinking level if supported). 2. In Telegram adapter (and future channel adapters): detect leading slash, parse command, execute or forward to backend. 3. Backend: optional GET /api/commands or handle command semantics in existing endpoints. 4. Document commands and behaviour in USER_GUIDE and channel-specific docs.

acceptance_criteria: At least /status, /reset, /think (or equivalent) defined and documented
Telegram adapter recognises and handles these commands
Behaviour is consistent (e.g. /status returns compact status)
Documentation updated for users and for future channel implementers

user_stories.story: As a user, I want to type /status in Telegram to see my session status without opening the dashboard.
As a user, I want to type /reset to start a fresh conversation.

technical_notes.current_issue: No standardised chat commands across channels
dependencies: Telegram adapter; PBI-045 if second channel adds commands
